std::string disptype_

Detailed Description

Encapsulates a displacement from the central molecule.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

void Displacement::accumulateTerms ( double  coef,
int  maxlevel 
)

Have all Taylor term polynomials with order <= maxlevel accumulate the contributions from this displacement. See TaylorTerm.

void Displacement::addEquivalentDisplacement ( boost::intrusive_ptr< Displacement >  disp,
RectMatrixPtr  symmop,
RectMatrixPtr  permop 
)

Links this displacement to another equivalent displacement. When an energy gets assigned to this displacement, all linked displacements will be assigned the same value. See DisplacementMapping::permop_ and DisplacementMapping::symmop_.

Parameters:
disp The equivalent displacement
symmop The 3x3 matrix representing the x,y,z transformation
permop The permutation matrix for the atoms.

void gigide::Displacement::addNonzeroTerms ( std::map< std::string, boost::intrusive_ptr< TaylorTerm > > &  terms,
double  tol = 1e-6 
)

Put all the nonzero Taylor term contributions to this displacement in the map based on a string label given by TaylorTerm::name()

Parameters:
terms The map to put the terms in
tol The tolerance for declaring a term to be zero

void Displacement::assignEnergy ( double  energy  ) 

Assigns an energy to this displacement. This will also assign the same energy to all equivalent displacements.

Parameters:
energy The energy to assign.

void Displacement::assignForceConstants ( RectMatrixPtr  xyzfc,
RectMatrixPtr  xyzgrads 
)

Given a set of force constants and gradients, transform the force constants to internal coordinates and store them.

Parameters:
xyzfc The force constants
xyzgrads The xyz gradients

void Displacement::assignGradients ( RectMatrixPtr  gradients  ) 

Assigns the gradient. This will also assign gradients to all equivalent displacements. Though displacements may be equivalent, their orientation may be different. In this case, the transformation between them must be determined by relating their displacement matrices.

Parameters:
gradients The gradients to assign
disp The displacement matrix for the assigning displacement. This allows the displacement to translate the gradients based on orientation differences.

void gigide::Displacement::assignTerms ( std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr< TaylorTerm > > &  terms  ) 

Assign the set of Taylor terms to this displacement. This will filter to only keep track of the nonzero terms.

Parameters:
terms The terms to link to

void Displacement::clearMappings (  ) 

Clears the set of equivalent displacements. See equiv_disps_.

double Displacement::computeDisplacement ( boost::intrusive_ptr< Molecule >  mol,
boost::intrusive_ptr< InternalCoordinate >  coord,
double  disp 
) [static]

Compute how many units along a given internal coordinate the molecule is displaced.

Parameters:
mol The molecule to compute the displacement on
coord The coordinate to compute the displacement along
disp The displacement size for the coordinate. For example, if the internal coordinate value is displaced 0.02 along the coordinate and disp is 0.1, then the method would return 2.0 as the displacement size.
Returns:
The displacement size as a multiple of disp

Returns the set of internal coordinates the displacement is based on.

Returns:
The internal coordinates

) [static]

Generates a molecule with the followintg displacements in the internal coordinates.

Parameters:
displacements The displacement sizes from the current molecular geometry
mol A "guess" molecule for the final geometry
coords The internal coordinates
simples The simple internal coordinates the internals are based on

double Displacement::displacement ( int  i  ) 

Return the displacement extent of the ith coordinate in this displacement. This corresponds to multiples of the displacement size. For example, suppose you are computing the first derivative of the second coordinate as

If this is the displacement, then the function would return
displacement(0) -> 0
displacement(1) -> 0
displacement(2) -> -1

Returns:
The displacement extent

double Displacement::dispmag (  ) 

Send back the x,y,z magnitude of the displacement. See dispmag_.

Returns:
Displacement magnitude.

RectMatrixPtr Displacement::getDisplacementMatrix (  ) 

Sends back the displacement matrix associated with the displacment. This is just the the sum of the B vectors for the individual coordinates scaled by the displacement size. See InternalCoordinate::bmatrix_.

Returns:
The xyz B vector displacements for this displacements.

Returns the label for the displacement. See label_

bool gigide::Displacement::matches ( std::vector< double > &  disps  ) 

Whether this displacement matches a given set of displacements. See displacement. This is equivalent to loop all elements of the vector and checking if disps[i] == displacement(i).

Parameters:
disps The set of displacements

void gigide::Displacement::print ( std::ostream &  os = std::cout  ) 

Prints a descriptive label

Parameters:
os The output stream to print to

Reset all the Taylor terms associated with this displacement. See TaylorTerm::reset.

Sets the uniqueness of the displacement.

Member Data Documentation

std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr<InternalCoordinate> > gigide::Displacement::coords_ [private]

The set of coordinates the displacement is built on

double gigide::Displacement::degree_ [private]

The degree of the displacement. This is just the sum of the vector displacements_. This variable is necessary for quick validation of the equivalence of two displacements

RectMatrixPtr gigide::Displacement::displacement_matrix_ [private]

The displacement matrix defining the displacement. This is derived from the B-matrix

std::vector<double> gigide::Displacement::displacements_ [private]

The list of integers defining the displacements. Suppose we have the coordinate sets R(O1-H2), R(O1-H3), A(H2-O1-H3). A displacement of 0.5 along R(O1-H2), 0 along R(O1-H3), and 2.0 along A(H2-O1-H3) would be represented as would be <0.5, 0, 2.0>

double gigide::Displacement::dispmag_ [private]

The x,y,z magnitude of a unit displacement along the coordinate.

boost::intrusive_ptr<Molecule> gigide::Displacement::dispmol_ [private]

The molecule representing the displaced geometry

std::string gigide::Displacement::disptype_ [private]

A string describing the displacement type. This is essentially label_ but with the zeroes removed and the values sorted. Equivalent displacements will have equivalent displacement types.

double gigide::Displacement::energy_ [private]

The energy at this displacement point. Units here should match the units in the input file

bool gigide::Displacement::energy_assigned_ [private]

Whether or not an energy has been assigned yet to this displacement

std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr<DisplacementMapping> > gigide::Displacement::equiv_disps_ [private]

The std::vector of equivalent displacements. This is included so that the energies of the equivalent displacements can be filled in later from this displacement's energy

RectMatrixPtr gigide::Displacement::fc_ [private]

The force constants at this displacement point, if force constants are computed

bool gigide::Displacement::fc_assigned_ [private]

Whether or force constants have been assigned yet to this displacement

bool gigide::Displacement::grad_assigned_ [private]

Whether or not gradients have been assigned yet to this displacement

VectorPtr gigide::Displacement::gradients_ [private]

The gradients at this displacement point, if gradients are computed

std::string gigide::Displacement::label_ [private]

The label for the displacement. The label is exactly the vector displacements_

boost::intrusive_ptr<Molecule> gigide::Displacement::mol_ [private]

The center molecule of the force field

int gigide::Displacement::refcount_ [private]

The "reference count" of the displacement. This is the number of derivative fitting functions which require this displacement.

Reimplemented from gigide::Countable.

std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr<SimpleInternalCoordinate> > gigide::Displacement::simples_ [private]

The set of simple internal coordinates used to generate the displaced geometry

std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr<TaylorTerm> > gigide::Displacement::terms_ [private]

In testing a given fitting function, the displacement will be a sum of different polynomial terms involving derivatives. These polynomial terms are encapsulated by this vector.

bool gigide::Displacement::unique_ [private]

Whether or not the displacement is unique or if it is equivalent to another displacement.
